thread.title: Patriots will need biggest comeback in Super Bowl history to beat Falcons
thread.title_full: Patriots will need biggest comeback in Super Bowl history to beat Falcons

author: Blake Schuster
title: Patriots will need biggest comeback in Super Bowl history to beat Falcons
text: NFL Patriots will need biggest comeback in Super Bowl history to beat Falcons The Patriots have come back from down 10 in the Super Bowl in the past, but no team has won after facing a bigger deficit. Rec Photo by Jamie Squire/Getty Images If Tom Brady and the Patriots are going to find a way to win Super Bowl LI, they’ll have to defy history first. No team has won the Super Bowl after trailing by more than 10 points. Nearing halftime, New England finds itself down 21-0. So the odds are certainly not in the Patriots favor. When New England beat the Seahawks in Super Bowl XLIX, the Patriots were down 10 in the third quarter before scoring 14 in the final frame to notch the win — and even then it came down to final goal-line stand. ESPN gave the Falcons an 86.2 percent chance to win after scoring their second touchdown, but that didn’t necessarily mean much as recent history show. Atlanta now has an 86% chance of winning, per ESPN. That's about the same Clinton's chances heading into the election pic.twitter.com/fNpBPSO8tJ — Nate Cohn (@Nate_Cohn) February 6, 2017 Following the Patriots’ pick-six, the win probability jumped to 96.6 percent. History says this one is over. It’s not like Tom Brady needs another Super Bowl record on his resume, anyway. In this Storystream
